learning_outcomes.description: Appraise coaching situations from multiple theoretical standpoints.
Recognise events of significance within accounts of coaching practice.
Integrate applicable research perspectives within explanations of coaching.
Review your own personal coaching history to clearly deliver critical insights.

assessments.assessment_title: Case study summaries and video presentations
assessments.task_description:
As per seminar task sheets:

Written submission (1000 words): summaries of each paper including the key features, circumstances, issues, and theorists comprising the case study

Video submission (5 min): more in depth exploration of one paper that considers how the authors set the scene, integrated theory and practice, presented the case, and connected to your own experiences
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Personal case study plan and peer assessment
assessments.due_date:
Part A: Discussion Board 29/09/2025 - 7/10/2025

Part B: Case Study Plan 7/10/2025 - 13/10/2025

Part C: Peer Review 13/10/2025 - 20/10/2025

5:00pm
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Participation/ Student contribution
assessments.task_description:
As per task sheet:

Part A: Case study plan - one written post to the Discussion Board detailing key content of proposed case study

Part B: Case study plan - 1 page written submission detailing key content of proposed case study

Part C: Case study plan peer review - provide feedback on the peer case study plan/s allocated to you
